programme.title: Peter Pan
Peter Pan
programme.desc:
Peter Pan: Directed by P.J. Hogan. With Jason Isaacs, Jeremy Sumpter, Rachel Hurd-Wood, Lynn Redgrave. The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0316396/","name":"Peter Pan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0ODI2MzA0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjUzMzg2._V1_.jpg","description":"The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0316396/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"acrutherford2004"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A superb rendition of a favourite of adults and children","reviewBody":"This is by far the most accurate and striking adaptation of the J.M. Barrie favourite that has yet been made. Indeed it is difficult to see how it could have been better.

Whilst I'm writing here in praise of the film, I feel I must take issue with the comments of Mr John Ulmer who criticised the film for a number of reasons. I seek to defend the story of Peter Pan and in particular this version. Firstly, it was said that this version has sexual over/undertones.

Erm... well yes... any accurate portrayal of the story would have, as these subtleties are present en masse in the book, indeed more so in the book than in the film it could be argued. It is precisely this evident descent towards Wendy's loss of innocence that both disturbs and excites adult readers of the books and this is quite intentional. Children who are not of an age to appreciate this level are untouched by it but rather take delight in the glorious idea of never having to grow up but instead being allowed to play forever. Indeed the relationship between Pan and Hook is the struggle of youth to overcome the onset of age (singular human vanity and innocent childish rebellion combined). I do not believe that this film's handling of this aspect of the book was merely present in "sick adult humour", I believe that it was beautifully hinted at in a way which would stimulate adult appreciation and childish fascination in the character of Pan.

I should like to make mention of the parallel which Mr Ulmer draws between this version of Peter Pan and Jumanji (namely the use of the same actors to play the adversary and the father of the lead character) is not just a trick put in to hark back to that film. Indeed the tradition of the same actor playing the role of Mr Darling AND Hook dates back to the story's original appearance as a stage play at the turn of the century and has been carried on on most occasions since then, though I concede that the Disney version (a far less worthy and sterilised version) failed to keep this tradition up.

As for the point at which the two boys are hung upside down in their nightshirts, I thought it was funny, as did the rest of the audience in the theatre and we certainly weren't there with a red pen counting the number of bottom shots as Mr Ulmer appears to have done. This film is full of charming humour, adult overtones for the adults, childish fantasy and wonderment for those of the appropriate age. The acting is superb in all areas and I must make particular mention of both Ludivine Sagnier as a wickedly funny Tink and of course Rachel Hurd-Wood whose screen debut showed her as a previously undiscovered talent who will surely go far. All the others were excellent also.

All in all this film rekindled my love of the book which I have now re-read a number of times and makes up for all those years Pan has spent in the Disney wilderness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69987,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2003-12-31","keywords":"peter pan character,captain hook character,smee character,wendy darling character,gagged girl","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Peter Pan","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2077470745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRiODI5MmEtMGZkOC00NTc4LWIyMGUtOTE5ZmVkMzZjNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRiODI5MmEtMGZkOC00NTc4LWIyMGUtOTE5ZmVkMzZjNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Peter Pan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838911/","name":"Jeremy Sumpter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005042/","name":"Jason Isaacs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931404/","name":"Olivia Williams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0057381/","name":"J.M. Barrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325533/","name":"Michael Goldenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Little Women
Little Women
programme.desc:
Little Women: Directed by Greta Gerwig. With Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen. Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scenematica"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Love this little cute dear 4 women","reviewBody":"What we can expect from the girl as a movie director?

Meet Greta, a great director that will make you blame The Academy for not including her as Oscar Best Director nominees. For me, IMHO, she is more entitled to get Oscar Best Director nomination than Todd Philips.

How she direct the entire cast and crew, a camera movement, a music selection, everything is amazing.

A story plot that uses forward and backward flow (a non-linear plot) packed very cleverly. programme.title: Peter Pan
Peter Pan
programme.desc:
Peter Pan: Directed by P.J. Hogan. With Jason Isaacs, Jeremy Sumpter, Rachel Hurd-Wood, Lynn Redgrave. The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0316396/","name":"Peter Pan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0ODI2MzA0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjUzMzg2._V1_.jpg","description":"The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0316396/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"acrutherford2004"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A superb rendition of a favourite of adults and children","reviewBody":"This is by far the most accurate and striking adaptation of the J.M. Barrie favourite that has yet been made. Indeed it is difficult to see how it could have been better.

Whilst I'm writing here in praise of the film, I feel I must take issue with the comments of Mr John Ulmer who criticised the film for a number of reasons. I seek to defend the story of Peter Pan and in particular this version. Firstly, it was said that this version has sexual over/undertones.

Erm... well yes... any accurate portrayal of the story would have, as these subtleties are present en masse in the book, indeed more so in the book than in the film it could be argued. It is precisely this evident descent towards Wendy's loss of innocence that both disturbs and excites adult readers of the books and this is quite intentional. Children who are not of an age to appreciate this level are untouched by it but rather take delight in the glorious idea of never having to grow up but instead being allowed to play forever. Indeed the relationship between Pan and Hook is the struggle of youth to overcome the onset of age (singular human vanity and innocent childish rebellion combined). I do not believe that this film's handling of this aspect of the book was merely present in "sick adult humour", I believe that it was beautifully hinted at in a way which would stimulate adult appreciation and childish fascination in the character of Pan.

I should like to make mention of the parallel which Mr Ulmer draws between this version of Peter Pan and Jumanji (namely the use of the same actors to play the adversary and the father of the lead character) is not just a trick put in to hark back to that film. Indeed the tradition of the same actor playing the role of Mr Darling AND Hook dates back to the story's original appearance as a stage play at the turn of the century and has been carried on on most occasions since then, though I concede that the Disney version (a far less worthy and sterilised version) failed to keep this tradition up.

As for the point at which the two boys are hung upside down in their nightshirts, I thought it was funny, as did the rest of the audience in the theatre and we certainly weren't there with a red pen counting the number of bottom shots as Mr Ulmer appears to have done. This film is full of charming humour, adult overtones for the adults, childish fantasy and wonderment for those of the appropriate age. The acting is superb in all areas and I must make particular mention of both Ludivine Sagnier as a wickedly funny Tink and of course Rachel Hurd-Wood whose screen debut showed her as a previously undiscovered talent who will surely go far. All the others were excellent also.

All in all this film rekindled my love of the book which I have now re-read a number of times and makes up for all those years Pan has spent in the Disney wilderness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69987,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2003-12-31","keywords":"peter pan character,captain hook character,smee character,wendy darling character,gagged girl","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Peter Pan","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2077470745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRiODI5MmEtMGZkOC00NTc4LWIyMGUtOTE5ZmVkMzZjNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRiODI5MmEtMGZkOC00NTc4LWIyMGUtOTE5ZmVkMzZjNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Peter Pan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838911/","name":"Jeremy Sumpter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005042/","name":"Jason Isaacs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931404/","name":"Olivia Williams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0057381/","name":"J.M. Barrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325533/","name":"Michael Goldenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0ODI2MzA0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjUzMzg2._V1_QL75_UY281_CR2,0,190,281_.jpg

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
Arthur Weihnachtsmann
programme.desc:
Arthur Christmas: Directed by Sarah Smith, Barry Cook. With James McAvoy, Hugh Laurie, Bill Nighy, Jim Broadbent. Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with Grandsanta to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than two hours." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1430607/","name":"Arthur Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY4Njk5OGQtZGMzYS00NmRhLTgxMzMtYzE0YzE1MDg4NDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA4NjE0NjEy._V1_.jpg","description":"Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with Grandsanta to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than two hours.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1430607/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Scrooge-3"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Delightfully charming","reviewBody":"Arthur Claus (James McAvoy) is the bumbling son of the reigning Santa, Malcolm Claus (Jim Broadbent). Arthur is relegated to the Letter Department where he can presumably do no damage. Arthur's brother Steve (Hugh Laurie) is the heir apparent to the title of Santa. Steve is handsome, confident, and in charge of the North Pole command center that monitors Santa's gift-giving flight around the world. The film opens with a bravura set piece showing how Santa is able to stop in millions of homes in one night. Hint: he has the help of thousands of elves. 

When Arthur discovers that one gift was accidentally undelivered, he becomes determined to get it to the unfortunate girl before Christmas sunrise. Even with the help of his retired grandsanta (Bill Nighy) and a perky elf (Ashley Jensen) from the Wrapping Department, can Arthur travel around the world in time?

There have been many movies over the years where Christmas must be saved from disaster, but Arthur Christmas has a very creative take on it. From the opening scene where it's established that Santa is really a dynasty through the centuries, a title handed down from father to son, to the paramilitary operation to get millions of presents delivered in one night, to the misadventures of Arthur and his grandsanta as they try to make sure one little girl is not disappointed, Arthur Christmas is fun, creative, and original. Produced by Aardman Animations in association with Sony Pictures Animation, this CGI animated film delivers Aardman's distinct brand of quirky humor and style. 

The art direction maintains the slightly skewed look of an Aardman claymation film. The character designs are asymmetric and the surface textures are realistic yet bold. The North Pole command center and Santa's high-tech sleigh are clean and modern. 

Sometimes celebrity voice talent backfires, but here it works beautifully, the English accents lending a sense of gravity that heightens the silliness. Bill Nighy is particularly good, conveying wisdom that is tinged with resentment of the modern gift-delivery methods his son and grandson use. 

Arthur Christmas is a funny, heartwarming, and poignant look at the Santa Claus mythos, adding a family dynamic that will resonate with children and adults. I expect Arthur Christmas will become a joyful holiday favorite for years to come.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54952,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-11-11","keywords":"christmas,elf,christmas eve,resentment,santa claus","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677710361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODQzNjA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODM5OTc4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODQzNjA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODM5OTc4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas night at the North Pole, Santa's youngest son looks to use his father's high-tech operation for an urgent mission. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564215/","name":"James McAvoy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809877/","name":"Sarah Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176905/","name":"Barry Cook"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103531/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063165/","name":"Peter Baynham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809877/","name":"Sarah Smith"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Planet 51
Planet 51
programme.desc:
Planet 51: Directed by Jorge Blanco, Javier Abad, Marcos Martínez. With Dwayne Johnson, Jessica Biel, Justin Long, Gary Oldman. An alien civilization is invaded by Astronaut Chuck Baker, who believes that the planet was uninhabited. Wanted by the military, Baker must get back to his ship before it goes into orbit without him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0762125/","name":"Planet 51","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzA3NDEwMGYtZWVmNi00MDRiLWExYWItM2I1ZTQ5NDI4NTQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An alien civilization is invaded by Astronaut Chuck Baker, who believes that the planet was uninhabited. Wanted by the military, Baker must get back to his ship before it goes into orbit without him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0762125/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bluestrat70"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Not Great","reviewBody":"I took my 8 year old daughter and her friend to see this opening night. There was a decent size crowd who seemed to enjoy it. For ESPN fans one of their long time personalities, who has his own video short series on the website, was there. But I digress.

It took a while to realize that it definitely was Dwayne Johnson as the astronaut's voice. He's created a great niche for himself in family films and I think he does good job. Justin Long was a good choice for the lead "alien" Lem and John Cleese is always a good choice as he did a small role as the professor. The role of Skiff brought good humor to many scenes. Sean William Scott was very animated in his voice acting for this character. Other than Rover and the hippie-like guy, the rest of the characters are just back drops without adding much.

We laughed quite a bit throughout the movie, which is mostly the point. There was plenty of cute humor with the dog-like robot Rover, who was a little reminiscent of WALL-E, a little. The down-side was that it never drew you in to fully connect, sympathize, like or dislike any of the characters. I didn't see myself rooting for anyone over anyone else. If the message is supposed to be about not judging anyone based on appearance, that message was shallow. If the message was to keep an open-mind toward what is possible and to learn new things, that message was under-developed.

Bottom line, the kids enjoyed it and we had a good entertaining night out. So in that respect it served its' purpose. The animation was suitable and I liked the 50's like theme of the planet. One or two adult humor jokes in there that could have been omitted and not change the movie.

For a family movie 7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-11-20","keywords":"outer space,hovercar,astronomical object in title,alien,alien planet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Planet 51 -- Trailer #2 ","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1592656409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3MTcwMTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTYxODg2Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3MTcwMTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTYxODg2Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The inhabitants of Planet 51 live in fear of alien invasion. Their paranoia is realized when an astronaut arrives from Earth. Befriended by a young resident, he has to avoid capture in order to recover his spaceship and try to return home."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005405/","name":"Seann William Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3360961/","name":"Jorge Blanco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3371961/","name":"Javier Abad"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3483756/","name":"Marcos Martínez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0202069/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103514/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3371961/","name":"Javier Abad"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3360961/","name":"Jorge Blanco"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Die Wilden Hühner
Die wilden Hühner
programme.desc: Die Wilden Hühner: Directed by Vivian Naefe. With Michelle von Treuberg, Lucie Hollmann, Paula Romy, Zsá Zsá Inci. Sprotte is about 12 years old and has a "gang" with her three friends Frieda, Melanie and Trude. Together the girls take Care of Sprottes grandmothers chickens. The new girl in School, Wilma, wishes to join the group, which Melanie is very unhappy about, and on top of all of that they have an on going revalisasion with a group of boys. Sprottes grandmother is planning on slaughtering the chickens! Will the Wild Chicks put Down their war with the boys? And Will they be able to save the chicken?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0466195/","name":"Die Wilden Hühner","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA4ZjM0ZDMtMDdmZi00NzJhLWE3YjItOGVlZTZjZjE0Y2M1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sprotte is about 12 years old and has a "gang" with her three friends Frieda, Melanie and Trude. Together the girls take Care of Sprottes grandmothers chickens. The new girl in School, Wilma, wishes to join the group, which Melanie i","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0466195/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xenzi"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nicely done","reviewBody":"I've never been much of a fan of Cornelia Funke's "Wilde Hühner" books, so I took my 7-year-old daughter to see this with some reluctance. I was agreeably surprised, though. The story works, the kids are great, and what I liked best was the realistic portrayal of their family backgrounds, not quite the common fare in kid's movies. Most of it was subtly done, like in some of Astrid Lindgren's stories. These kids' troubles are for real, and if there's evil in this film, it's the evil of thoughtless neglect on the part of the parents. Every kid (and adult) can identify with that. The dialog tended to be too heavy sometimes, but this is the only real fault I could find. Gripping and touching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":715,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2006-02-09","keywords":"friendship,teacher,friend,strong female,chicken","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1922105/","name":"Michelle von Treuberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2080273/","name":"Lucie Hollmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1743114/","name":"Paula Romy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0618996/","name":"Vivian Naefe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1751315/","name":"Cornelia Funke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438651/","name":"Güzin Kar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0716966/","name":"Uschi Reich"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
Die Peanuts – Der Film
programme.desc:
The Peanuts Movie: Directed by Steve Martino. With Trombone Shorty, Rebecca Bloom, Anastasia Bredikhina, Francesca Capaldi. Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their archnemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home to win the love of his life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2452042/","name":"The Peanuts Movie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE5NzMxNzkwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ0Nzk5NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their archnemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home to win the love of his life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2452042/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tenderlovingtony"},"dateCreated":"2015-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nothing but Classic Peanuts!!!","reviewBody":"The new Peanuts movie is sensational. It is absolutely classic Peanuts. They have not wrecked Peanuts by making it a 21st century melodrama that deals with issues of various sorts.

The Peanuts Movie is a superbly animated retelling of stories that we all know: the kite-eating tree, Snoopy vs. the Red Baron, the Little Red-Haired Girl, and on and on.

The voices are mostly done by unknowns. The only recognizable name in the cast is Kristin Chenoweth as Snoopy's love interest, Fifi. The children seem to have been cast to mimic as closely as possible the voicing from the 1960s TV specials.

There is even a reference to late Peanuts creator Charles M. Schulz and his nickname Sparky. Schulz's sons produced this movie and they did a remarkably faithful job of reviving his father's creation; they kept new, unwelcome ideas from infringing on the Peanuts legacy.

This was wonderful to watch in 3D.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":44349,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-12-31","keywords":"peanuts,popularity,school,imagination,beagle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1443476249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4MzI2NTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIzMTk4NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4MzI2NTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIzMTk4NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their arch-nemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6907855/","name":"Noah Schnapp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006837/","name":"Bill Melendez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5295511/","name":"Hadley Belle Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0553942/","name":"Steve Martino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179259/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0409029/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0776441/","name":"Craig Schulz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2421049/","name":"Bryan Schulz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2370700/","name":"Cornelius Uliano"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally..
Harry und Sally
programme.desc: When Harry Met Sally...: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan, Carrie Fisher, Bruno Kirby. Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098635/","name":"When Harry Met Sally...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0ODEwNjM2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjU2Mzg3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098635/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PyrolyticCarbon"},"dateCreated":"2002-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful film, giving hope to all those seemingly unrequited loves.","reviewBody":"Can you beat some of the lines in this film? As a guy, which I am, I identified with Harry's lines so much, and you can't help but side with him. The chemistry between the two actors, Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan is superb, and you believe in them when they talk, you feel for them when they look at each other. Even the friends are well casted, Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby. It's such relaxed acting and filming that you do nothing but watch these people fall in love, and pretty soon you feel like you're involved as well. With a fantastic soundtrack, direction, script and acting, it's a great film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":207102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1989-07-21","keywords":"male female friendship,opposites attract,fake orgasm,new york,pessimist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi129743385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjYyZjk1ZDMtMGJmZC00YmI0LWJhYTYtYzA1MDcyN2JhOTU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000345/","name":"Billy Crystal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000402/","name":"Carrie Fisher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020346/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
Schlaflos in Seattle
programme.desc: Sleepless in Seattle: Directed by Nora Ephron. With Tom Hanks, Ross Malinger, Rita Wilson, Victor Garber. A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0108160/","name":"Sleepless in Seattle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY1MDJkZGUtZTE2OS00ODZiLTlmNzQtMDZjNzM2ZjkwM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rebochan"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"It succeeds at what it sets out to do","reviewBody":"I won't lie to you-this movie is a CHICK FLICK! Though I never saw it with a guy, it is definitely a chick flick. That said, it's a high-end chick flick, which probably a few guys might enjoy, unless they happen to be the exploding helicopter type^^; This movie feels more like a modern day adaptation of the classic romance "An Affair To Remember," and it keeps referencing it too (In fact, the Cary Grant classic is very integral to the plot). Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan have great chemistry together, and they both do what they're good at-Tom Hanks portraying the Everyman, and Meg Ryan being cute and innocent. I have to disagree with an earlier comment that this film is unfair to guys-the way the characters are portrayed, I'd have to say that in the reverse situation, I'd still feel the same way. Meg Ryan does not have the "evil woman" syndrome that popped up in later 90's chick flicks (The most notorious of which was "My Best Friend's Wedding"). She is very believable and actually does care about the feelings of her fiance. What I particularly liked is that the fiance was not portrayed as someone who Meg would do well to leave. Most movies fall into this trap-Someone is about to marry someone who is horrible and find that someone else is better, the viewer supposedly not feeling bad because the fiance was a jerk anyway. Tom Hanks really shines here as someone who has lost the most important person in his life and is trying to rebuild again. He always has a knack for easily slipping into the roles he's given and making them really convincing. He does not fail here-you feel for him especially during the sequences where he starts remembering his late wife. The movie's plot starts to stretch plausibility at the end, but not to the point where it destroys the entire film. The ending scene in particular is handled very carefully. You could have had a big, romantic, tear-jerking moment. Instead, the movie takes a more simplistic approach, and it succeeds-it feels much more natural than the alternative. Overall, if you're in for a feel good romance, you should see this. If you happen to be female, this is DEFINITELY worth watching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-06-25","keywords":"radio show,seattle washington,colleague,diner,waitress","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi727367449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539678/","name":"Ross Malinger"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0033578/","name":"Jeff Arch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. Ward"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0108160/","name":"Sleepless in Seattle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY1MDJkZGUtZTE2OS00ODZiLTlmNzQtMDZjNzM2ZjkwM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108160/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Rebochan","dateCreated":"2001-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"It succeeds at what it sets out to do","reviewBody":"I won't lie to you-this movie is a CHICK FLICK! Though I never saw it with a guy, it is definitely a chick flick. That said, it's a high-end chick flick, which probably a few guys might enjoy, unless they happen to be the exploding helicopter type^^; This movie feels more like a modern day adaptation of the classic romance "An Affair To Remember," and it keeps referencing it too (In fact, the Cary Grant classic is very integral to the plot). Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan have great chemistry together, and they both do what they're good at-Tom Hanks portraying the Everyman, and Meg Ryan being cute and innocent. I have to disagree with an earlier comment that this film is unfair to guys-the way the characters are portrayed, I'd have to say that in the reverse situation, I'd still feel the same way. Meg Ryan does not have the "evil woman" syndrome that popped up in later 90's chick flicks (The most notorious of which was "My Best Friend's Wedding"). She is very believable and actually does care about the feelings of her fiance. What I particularly liked is that the fiance was not portrayed as someone who Meg would do well to leave. Most movies fall into this trap-Someone is about to marry someone who is horrible and find that someone else is better, the viewer supposedly not feeling bad because the fiance was a jerk anyway. Tom Hanks really shines here as someone who has lost the most important person in his life and is trying to rebuild again. He always has a knack for easily slipping into the roles he's given and making them really convincing. He does not fail here-you feel for him especially during the sequences where he starts remembering his late wife. The movie's plot starts to stretch plausibility at the end, but not to the point where it destroys the entire film. The ending scene in particular is handled very carefully. You could have had a big, romantic, tear-jerking moment. Instead, the movie takes a more simplistic approach, and it succeeds-it feels much more natural than the alternative. Overall, if you're in for a feel good romance, you should see this. If you happen to be female, this is DEFINITELY worth watching.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":168328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-06-25","keywords":"radio show,seattle washington,colleague,diner,waitress","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi727367449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539678/","name":"Ross Malinger"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0033578/","name":"Jeff Arch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. programme.title: Serendipity
Weil es dich gibt
programme.desc: Serendipity: Directed by Peter Chelsom. With John Cusack, Kate Beckinsale, Jeremy Piven, Bridget Moynahan. A couple search for each other years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0240890/","name":"Serendipity","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWFhZTc4NDEtNDA0MS00NmFiLWFlNzUtMDM0NTExNjc3NzZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzI0NDc4ODY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple search for each other years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0240890/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"enigma_777_f"},"dateCreated":"2003-09-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"it can and it does happen","reviewBody":"Since I have always wondered about fate/destiny and the alike, it was not for one moment, hard for me to embrace this movie. To me, this movie signifies the importance of saying what you feel and feeling what you say. All to often in life people pass each other by and subsequently up all because of being afraid to feel, say, think, and of what others will think. I have tried to become more honest in my life as a result of seeing this movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108841,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-04-03","keywords":"fate,destiny,serendipity,christmas,coincidence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Serendipity","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi735092249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NjEwNDYtZTM4ZS00OWRiLTlmZWMtYjljODgwOWQxNjkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NjEwNDYtZTM4ZS00OWRiLTlmZWMtYjljODgwOWQxNjkwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #3"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000131/","name":"John Cusack"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000295/","name":"Kate Beckinsale"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005315/","name":"Jeremy Piven"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155093/","name":"Peter Chelsom"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018522/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044742/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458884/","name":"Marc Klein"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Joy
Joy – Alles ausser gewöhnlich
programme.desc:
Joy: Directed by David O. Russell. With Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro, Bradley Cooper, Edgar Ramírez. Joy is the story of the title character, who rose to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2446980/","name":"Joy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzRiOWZmMzUtZTJiOC00MjQ1LTkwMjgtNzhlYzBmODAzYTA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Joy is the story of the title character, who rose to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2446980/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkrauser-81-311064"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent Half a Movie","reviewBody":"Joy is a fine half a film. The performances all-around are strong, the story is uncommon enough to grab your attention, and keep you invested, and the direction is solid. With all that in mind, Joy still feels like a shallow version of what could have been. There is a reason why all the movie's Oscar buzz has all but dissipated in every category except a courtesy nod to Jennifer Lawrence as Best Actress; Why? You should read on.

Lawrence plays the titular character, a mother of two with a very complicated home life. Though divorced, her ex-husband (Ramirez) lives in the basement waiting for his singing career to take off. Though she has decidedly negative relationships with her parents, her shut-in mother (Madsen) lives with her and her father (De Niro) is a serial divorcée with a struggling auto repair shop. It's also the 1980's and she works the night shift for an Airline that's dramatically cutting back hours; yikes. The only thing she has going for her is she likes to tinker and has the work ethic to see a good idea through. So when she has a eureka moment after a failed excursion on her father's new girlfriend's boat, she quickly invents a household object that may just be her ticket out of systemic poverty.

I don't think I'm giving much away by saying the movie asks its audience to hinge their emotional cache on a mop. The self-wringing Miracle Mop to be exact, invented by honest-to-God real person Joy Mangano. Leave it to director David O. Russell to find a decent story in the life of a QVC luminary and keep it just this side of rational. The prologue of the film lovingly dedicates the movie to "daring women," which Joy certainly is but Russell wisely omits the last name to give the audience a universality. This too can be your story of success if you have grit and a good idea. It's a great theme sadly worth a much better movie.

Part of the problem is the pace. There are long stretches of improvisations that carry absolutely no emotional weight. Unlike American Hustle (2013) and Silver Linings Playbook (2012) where the rushed, overlapping dialogue and melodramatic mugging serves to highlight the immediacy of, say dealing with the mob, here there's nothing holding us to the characters and their goals...except Joy. Russell seems to be aware of his own style and juxtaposes the lives on screen with an 80's era soap opera which consumes the life of Joy's mother. The parallel is interesting in theory but the results deflate the proceedings.

Not usually the voice of hope, I really wanted to like this movie. A movie about the positives of hard work and entrepreneurship has not hit theaters since Pursuit of Happyiness (2006). Yet out of all modern directors working today, David O. Russell feels like a quixotic mouthpiece for such a hopeful theme. His movies always have an unabashed pessimism about human nature that undermines his characters with an almost Bunuelian sense of treachery. Even as far back as his Three Kings (1999) days there was a mercurial, bittersweet undercurrent to his work. Joy bares disappointment after disappointment to a breaking point most protagonists of this genre would buckle under. Then, as if to put a band-aid on an open gash, the movie ends with an epilogue that's pat to the point of flimflam.

www.theyservepopcorninhell.blogspot.com","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":133041,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-12-30","keywords":"female inventor,sales pitch,parking lot,k mart,female name in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":""Success"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4091916825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzNzk4MjE4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzYzMDczNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzNzk4MjE4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzYzMDczNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Joy is the story of a family across four generations and the woman who rises to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2225369/","name":"Jennifer Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177896/","name":"Bradley Cooper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0751102/","name":"David O. Russell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0751102/","name":"David O. Little Women
programme.desc:
Little Women: Directed by Greta Gerwig. With Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen. Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scenematica"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Love this little cute dear 4 women","reviewBody":"What we can expect from the girl as a movie director?

Meet Greta, a great director that will make you blame The Academy for not including her as Oscar Best Director nominees. For me, IMHO, she is more entitled to get Oscar Best Director nomination than Todd Philips.

How she direct the entire cast and crew, a camera movement, a music selection, everything is amazing.

A story plot that uses forward and backward flow (a non-linear plot) packed very cleverly. It also shows how smart the use of transition in a film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170649,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"aspiring writer,poverty,mother daughter relationship,based on novel,death of sister","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2655304729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519680/","name":"Saoirse Ronan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6073955/","name":"Florence Pugh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0532247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017301/","name":"Louisa May Alcott"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Planet 51
Planet 51
programme.desc:
Planet 51: Directed by Jorge Blanco, Javier Abad, Marcos Martínez. With Dwayne Johnson, Jessica Biel, Justin Long, Gary Oldman. An alien civilization is invaded by Astronaut Chuck Baker, who believes that the planet was uninhabited. Wanted by the military, Baker must get back to his ship before it goes into orbit without him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0762125/","name":"Planet 51","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzA3NDEwMGYtZWVmNi00MDRiLWExYWItM2I1ZTQ5NDI4NTQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An alien civilization is invaded by Astronaut Chuck Baker, who believes that the planet was uninhabited. Wanted by the military, Baker must get back to his ship before it goes into orbit without him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0762125/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bluestrat70"},"dateCreated":"2009-11-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Not Great","reviewBody":"I took my 8 year old daughter and her friend to see this opening night. There was a decent size crowd who seemed to enjoy it. For ESPN fans one of their long time personalities, who has his own video short series on the website, was there. But I digress.

It took a while to realize that it definitely was Dwayne Johnson as the astronaut's voice. He's created a great niche for himself in family films and I think he does good job. Justin Long was a good choice for the lead "alien" Lem and John Cleese is always a good choice as he did a small role as the professor. The role of Skiff brought good humor to many scenes. Sean William Scott was very animated in his voice acting for this character. Other than Rover and the hippie-like guy, the rest of the characters are just back drops without adding much.

We laughed quite a bit throughout the movie, which is mostly the point. There was plenty of cute humor with the dog-like robot Rover, who was a little reminiscent of WALL-E, a little. The down-side was that it never drew you in to fully connect, sympathize, like or dislike any of the characters. I didn't see myself rooting for anyone over anyone else. If the message is supposed to be about not judging anyone based on appearance, that message was shallow. If the message was to keep an open-mind toward what is possible and to learn new things, that message was under-developed.

Bottom line, the kids enjoyed it and we had a good entertaining night out. So in that respect it served its' purpose. The animation was suitable and I liked the 50's like theme of the planet. One or two adult humor jokes in there that could have been omitted and not change the movie.

For a family movie 7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-11-20","keywords":"outer space,hovercar,astronomical object in title,alien,alien planet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Planet 51 -- Trailer #2 ","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1592656409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3MTcwMTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTYxODg2Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3MTcwMTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTYxODg2Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The inhabitants of Planet 51 live in fear of alien invasion. Their paranoia is realized when an astronaut arrives from Earth. Befriended by a young resident, he has to avoid capture in order to recover his spaceship and try to return home."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005405/","name":"Seann William Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3360961/","name":"Jorge Blanco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3371961/","name":"Javier Abad"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3483756/","name":"Marcos Martínez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0202069/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103514/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3371961/","name":"Javier Abad"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3360961/","name":"Jorge Blanco"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Vorstadtkrokodile
Vorstadtkrokodile
programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile: Directed by Christian Ditter. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0803100/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA2NTU0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDY1NDY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0803100/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jannispetersen"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful and moving modern version!","reviewBody":"I didn't know what to expect of the filmatisation of the well-known German novel Vorstadtkrokodile. What I actually can remember is that when I read this novel as a child, I back then thought of, it would be great as a movie. So when I saw this movie is in the cinemas, I had to watch it. And I'm very glad to have done so! First of all the cast is great! Axel Stein does a really great job and also Semmelrogge is very funny in his short scene. I didn't know any of the youngsters, but all of them played their part very well - you instantly buy their roles the way they play them! And then there is the modernization of the context. Enormeausly well-done! Many nice gags, where I laughed out loud! This is a movie for everyone: the youngsters, young adults (like me, I'm in the middle of my twenties) and the elder generation! I hope you have read the novel, but if you haven't, I'm sure you are eager to do, after you watched this fantastic movie.\n\nHeck! I even caught myself gladly smiling at the very end!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-03-26","keywords":"first part,animal in title,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728894/","name":"Martin Ritzenhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902149/","name":"Max von der Grün"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Vorstadtkrokodile 3
Vorstadtkrokodile 3
programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile 3: Directed by Wolfgang Groos. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1692503/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NTAyNjY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTMwMjA1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1692503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"One last time","reviewBody":"The kids are all grown up ... well they were not when this movie was made. Not entirely at least. Still a little bit older than when they started making them. So part 3 concludes their journey. And is as dramatic as they get. The inciting incident does not seem that big ... but turns out it is .. life an death and all that.\n\nHaving said that, the movie is still overall not riddled with heavy drama, even with that hanging over their heads, there is time for jealousy and other issues one might have growing up. We get our villains back from the first one, but this time around ... well we sort of hope they have grown up too ... not just physically but metaphorically speaking ... I reckon there is not too much mystery or things you'll be surprised will happen in the journey of the movie. Still a neat little movie that is mainly aimed at younger people.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":634,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-20","keywords":"boy in a wheelchair,overalls,stutterer,outtakes during end credits,working mom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0343185/","name":"Wolfgang Groos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0046910/","name":"Thomas Bahmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381074/","name":"Ralf Hertwig"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
Die Peanuts – Der Film
programme.desc:
The Peanuts Movie: Directed by Steve Martino. With Trombone Shorty, Rebecca Bloom, Anastasia Bredikhina, Francesca Capaldi. Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their archnemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home to win the love of his life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2452042/","name":"The Peanuts Movie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTE5NzMxNzkwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ0Nzk5NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their archnemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home to win the love of his life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2452042/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tenderlovingtony"},"dateCreated":"2015-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nothing but Classic Peanuts!!!","reviewBody":"The new Peanuts movie is sensational. It is absolutely classic Peanuts. They have not wrecked Peanuts by making it a 21st century melodrama that deals with issues of various sorts.

The Peanuts Movie is a superbly animated retelling of stories that we all know: the kite-eating tree, Snoopy vs. the Red Baron, the Little Red-Haired Girl, and on and on.

The voices are mostly done by unknowns. The only recognizable name in the cast is Kristin Chenoweth as Snoopy's love interest, Fifi. The children seem to have been cast to mimic as closely as possible the voicing from the 1960s TV specials.

There is even a reference to late Peanuts creator Charles M. Schulz and his nickname Sparky. Schulz's sons produced this movie and they did a remarkably faithful job of reviving his father's creation; they kept new, unwelcome ideas from infringing on the Peanuts legacy.

This was wonderful to watch in 3D.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":44349,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-12-31","keywords":"peanuts,popularity,school,imagination,beagle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1443476249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4MzI2NTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIzMTk4NjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI4MzI2NTMxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIzMTk4NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Snoopy embarks upon his greatest mission as he and his team take to the skies to pursue their arch-nemesis, while his best pal Charlie Brown begins his own epic quest back home."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6907855/","name":"Noah Schnapp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006837/","name":"Bill Melendez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5295511/","name":"Hadley Belle Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0553942/","name":"Steve Martino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179259/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047265/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0409029/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0776441/","name":"Craig Schulz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2421049/","name":"Bryan Schulz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2370700/","name":"Cornelius Uliano"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre
Asterix und Obelix: Mission Kleopatra
programme.desc: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre: Directed by Alain Chabat. With Gérard Depardieu, Christian Clavier, Jamel Debbouze, Monica Bellucci. Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0250223/","name":"Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q3NmUzNjAtM2VjMS00MGU3LWE4YjEtZTM1NDM0YTdlOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0250223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"they're crazy those Romans!","reviewBody":"In 1995, the movie "le hussard sur le toit" was released and it had a record; it was the most expensive movie ever made. This record was beaten seven years later with this film. But once again, this enormous budget was worth to be spending. Alain Chabat controls perfectly the huge incomes to his disposition (for example, sceneries are carefully restored and the crowd movements are wide) and he succeeds in recreating the fanciful atmosphere of the Astérix'albums. His making is very inventive, full of clever visuals and ringing brainwaves. Moreover, he doesn't only emphasize on the special effects of the movie and this was one of the faults of the first Astérix' film made by Claude Zidi in 1999. On the other hand, what a casting! It's very similar to the Sacha Guitry's film "si Versailles m'étais conté" and you can have fun by guessing which actor epitomize which character of the album "Astérix et Cléopâtre". As far as Christian Clavier and Gérard Depardieu are concerned, they're better managed than in the Zidi's film: they don't ham it up and are more credible in their respective roles even if Depardieu isn't fat enough. The other actors are excellent, (especially Gérard Darmon) rightly chosen even the minor actors in whom Chabat grants a big importance. Nevertheless, this one doesn't fit in the Caesar's role: he is a bit listless and not authoritarian enough. At last, let's notice that the characters' names are successful and funny puns (Menubestofplus, Numérobis, Itinéris), but they're only easily understood for French people. At the end, a successful adaptation of the Astérix's comic strip on the screen and a pleasant entertainment."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51219,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2002-01-30","keywords":"architect,based on comic book,egypt,druid,cleopatra","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979890201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000367/","name":"Gérard Depardieu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213354/","name":"Jamel Debbouze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049807/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331453/","name":"René Goscinny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879853/","name":"Albert Uderzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

Alain Chabat controls perfectly the huge incomes to his disposition (for example, sceneries are carefully restored and the crowd movements are wide) and he succeeds in recreating the fanciful atmosphere of the Astérix'albums. His making is very inventive, full of clever visuals and ringing brainwaves. Moreover, he doesn't only emphasize on the special effects of the movie and this was one of the faults of the first Astérix' film made by Claude Zidi in 1999. On the other hand, what a casting! It's very similar to the Sacha Guitry's film "si Versailles m'étais conté" and you can have fun by guessing which actor epitomize which character of the album "Astérix et Cléopâtre". As far as Christian Clavier and Gérard Depardieu are concerned, they're better managed than in the Zidi's film: they don't ham it up and are more credible in their respective roles even if Depardieu isn't fat enough. The other actors are excellent, (especially Gérard Darmon) rightly chosen even the minor actors in whom Chabat grants a big importance. Nevertheless, this one doesn't fit in the Caesar's role: he is a bit listless and not authoritarian enough. At last, let's notice that the characters' names are successful and funny puns (Menubestofplus, Numérobis, Itinéris), but they're only easily understood for French people. At the end, a successful adaptation of the Astérix's comic strip on the screen and a pleasant entertainment.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51219,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2002-01-30","keywords":"architect,based on comic book,egypt,druid,cleopatra","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979890201","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000367/","name":"Gérard Depardieu","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213354/","name":"Jamel Debbouze"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049807/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331453/","name":"René Goscinny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879853/","name":"Albert Uderzo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"],"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Joy
Joy – Alles ausser gewöhnlich
programme.desc:
Joy: Directed by David O. Russell. With Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro, Bradley Cooper, Edgar Ramírez. Joy is the story of the title character, who rose to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2446980/","name":"Joy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzRiOWZmMzUtZTJiOC00MjQ1LTkwMjgtNzhlYzBmODAzYTA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Joy is the story of the title character, who rose to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2446980/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkrauser-81-311064"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent Half a Movie","reviewBody":"Joy is a fine half a film. The performances all-around are strong, the story is uncommon enough to grab your attention, and keep you invested, and the direction is solid. With all that in mind, Joy still feels like a shallow version of what could have been. There is a reason why all the movie's Oscar buzz has all but dissipated in every category except a courtesy nod to Jennifer Lawrence as Best Actress; Why? You should read on.

Lawrence plays the titular character, a mother of two with a very complicated home life. Though divorced, her ex-husband (Ramirez) lives in the basement waiting for his singing career to take off. Though she has decidedly negative relationships with her parents, her shut-in mother (Madsen) lives with her and her father (De Niro) is a serial divorcée with a struggling auto repair shop. It's also the 1980's and she works the night shift for an Airline that's dramatically cutting back hours; yikes. The only thing she has going for her is she likes to tinker and has the work ethic to see a good idea through. So when she has a eureka moment after a failed excursion on her father's new girlfriend's boat, she quickly invents a household object that may just be her ticket out of systemic poverty.

I don't think I'm giving much away by saying the movie asks its audience to hinge their emotional cache on a mop. The self-wringing Miracle Mop to be exact, invented by honest-to-God real person Joy Mangano. Leave it to director David O. Russell to find a decent story in the life of a QVC luminary and keep it just this side of rational. The prologue of the film lovingly dedicates the movie to "daring women," which Joy certainly is but Russell wisely omits the last name to give the audience a universality. This too can be your story of success if you have grit and a good idea. It's a great theme sadly worth a much better movie.

Part of the problem is the pace. There are long stretches of improvisations that carry absolutely no emotional weight. Unlike American Hustle (2013) and Silver Linings Playbook (2012) where the rushed, overlapping dialogue and melodramatic mugging serves to highlight the immediacy of, say dealing with the mob, here there's nothing holding us to the characters and their goals...except Joy. Russell seems to be aware of his own style and juxtaposes the lives on screen with an 80's era soap opera which consumes the life of Joy's mother. The parallel is interesting in theory but the results deflate the proceedings.

Not usually the voice of hope, I really wanted to like this movie. A movie about the positives of hard work and entrepreneurship has not hit theaters since Pursuit of Happyiness (2006). Yet out of all modern directors working today, David O. Russell feels like a quixotic mouthpiece for such a hopeful theme. His movies always have an unabashed pessimism about human nature that undermines his characters with an almost Bunuelian sense of treachery. Even as far back as his Three Kings (1999) days there was a mercurial, bittersweet undercurrent to his work. Joy bares disappointment after disappointment to a breaking point most protagonists of this genre would buckle under. Then, as if to put a band-aid on an open gash, the movie ends with an epilogue that's pat to the point of flimflam.

www.theyservepopcorninhell.blogspot.com","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":133041,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-12-30","keywords":"female inventor,sales pitch,parking lot,k mart,female name in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":""Success"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4091916825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzNzk4MjE4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzYzMDczNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzNzk4MjE4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzYzMDczNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Joy is the story of a family across four generations and the woman who rises to become founder and matriarch of a powerful family business dynasty."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2225369/","name":"Jennifer Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177896/","name":"Bradley Cooper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0751102/","name":"David O. Russell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0751102/","name":"David O. Russell seems to be aware of his own style and juxtaposes the lives on screen with an 80's era soap opera which consumes the life of Joy's mother. The parallel is interesting in theory but the results deflate the proceedings.

Not usually the voice of hope, I really wanted to like this movie. A movie about the positives of hard work and entrepreneurship has not hit theaters since Pursuit of Happyiness (2006). Yet out of all modern directors working today, David O. Russell feels like a quixotic mouthpiece for such a hopeful theme. His movies always have an unabashed pessimism about human nature that undermines his characters with an almost Bunuelian sense of treachery. Joy bares disappointment after disappointment to a breaking point most protagonists of this genre would buckle under. Then, as if to put a band-aid on an open gash, the movie ends with an epilogue that's pat to the point of flimflam.
